prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other and the sides are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The model is symmetrical along the central axis. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.45 m, 0.45 m, and 0.0938 m, respectively. 1. Create a new coordinate system for this part. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a closed loop with the following lines and arcs (in order): - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.15, 0) - Line 2: (0.15, 0) to (0.15, 0.1219) - Line 3: (0.15, 0.1219) to (0.3, 0.1219) - Line 4: (0.3, 0.1219) to (0.3, 0) - Line 5: (0.3, 0) to (0.45, 0) - Line 6: (0.45, 0) to (0.45, 0.375) - Line 7: (0.45, 0.375) to (0, 0.375) - Line 8: (0, 0.375) to (0, 0) 4. Scale the sketch using a scaling factor of 0.45. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.0938 towards the normal and 0 extrusion depth opposite the normal. Part 2: Construct a second rectangular prism on top of the first part, with a slightly different angle for the top face. 1. Create a new coordinate system for this part, with the same origin as the previous part, but with a different orientation (0, 0.375, 0) for the translation vector. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a closed loop with the following lines and arcs (in order): - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.45, 0) - Line 2: (0.45, 0) to (0.45, 0.375) - Line 3: (0.45, 0.375) to (0.3, 0.375) - Line 4: (0.3, 0.375) to (0.3, 0.2531) - Line 5: (0.3, 0.2531) to (0.15, 0.2531) - Line 6: (0.15, 0.2531) to (0.15, 0.375) - Line 7: (0.15, 0.375) to (0, 0.375) - Line 8: (0, 0.375) to (0, 0) 4. Scale the sketch using a scaling factor of 0.45. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.0938 towards the normal and 0 extrusion depth opposite the normal. Note: The extrusion operations for both parts are specified as "NewBodyFeatureOperation" and "JoinFeatureOperation", which can be interpreted as the first part being created as a new body, and the second part being added to the first part, creating a combined body.</description>
